info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 16 at 2:11PM MST until December 18 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations 1 to 3 inches at lower elevations, and 3 to 6 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 5 AM MST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact this evenings and Friday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
